_exec_summary.SummaryText:
PAYNESVILLE FARMERS UNION COOP OIL CO.
P.O.BOX 53
PAYNESVILLE, MN 56362
320-243-3751

FOR FURTHER INFORMATION, CONTACT JOHN VANDERBEEK, PLANT MGR.

RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN - EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1) THE FACILITY POLICY
           THE OWNERS , MANAGEMENT AND EMPLOYEES OF PAYNESVILLE FARMERS UNION COOP OIL CO. ARE COMMITTEED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA. IF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND/OR OTHER AUTHORITIES TO MITIGATE RELEASES AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASES TO THE PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

2) FACILTY INFORMATION
           - THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILITY IS THE STORAGE AND BLENDING OF FERTILIZERS FOR SALE TO THE FARMERS.
           - ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEICED. STORED AND DISTRIBUTED FOR BOTH DIRECT APPLICATION AND FOR BLENDING INTO MIXED -GRADE FERTILIZER FOR CROP PRODUCTION NUTRIENTS.
           - THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY STORED WOULD BE 345,000 POUNDS IN OUR 30,000 GALLON BULK TANK AND OUR 40NURSE TANKS. THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY HANDLED WOULD BE 345,000 POUNDS AVAILABLE.

3) THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM
            THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISIONS OF "SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, K-61.1". PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE, INC. AND THE STANDARDS OF THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION(OSHA),29 CFR1910.111, STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA". IN ADDITION, MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AMMONIA RULES.

4) THE FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
           THERE HAS BEEN ONLY ONE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT CAUSED ONE INJURY, AND LATER DEATH, OF AN EMPLOYEE OR SIGNIFICANT PROPERTY DAMAGE AT THE FACILITY NOR TO OUR KNOWLEDGE HAVE RESULTED IN OFFSITE DEATHS, INJURIES, EVACUATIONS, SHELTERING IN PLACE, PROPERTY DAMAGE OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE.

5) THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM
            TH

E FACILITY HAS 
                  (A) A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARD 29 CFR 1910.38.
                  (B) PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES THE EMERGENCY PANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT TO KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III(EPCRA).
                  A? COORDINATE WITH LOCAL EMERGENCY RESPONDERS.

6) PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY 
             SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ON GOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY. PEROIDIC EVALUATIONS ARE PERFORMED  TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS. THERE ARE NO ADDITIONAL SPECIFIC ANHYDROUS AMMONIA RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTATION AT THIS TIME.
